text: What looks like a handsome MAN walks along the shore of t NILE RIVER, its surface sparkling in the sun. He is

The God of Nature and Life. 40s. (The ages of gods are ho old they appear -- many are ancient.) He wears a simple crown. His immense power belied by a gentle, open demeano THOTH’S VOICE The god Osiris had dominion over the lands made bountiful by the Nile. The power of its waters flowed through him. And so he could make life. (CONTINUED)
LOTUS FLOWERS magically BLOOM as Osiris passes, sprouting from his footprints on the silty shore in a ribbon of lif

DESERT the color of blood lurks beyond the lush green lan Here stands another PYRAMID, made entirely of SAND... its surface in constant motion... held together by magic. THOTH’S VOICE Osiris’ brother Set ruled the far Desert, where nothing can grow. He drew vast power from the fire that burned at the center of the world.

Stands over a FIERY PIT IN THE EARTH, drawing sustenance its molten depths. 40s. The God of the Desert. Physically powerful, yet cunning. THOTH’S VOICE But despite his power, Set was eternally jealous of his brother... because Osiris could give life -- and he could not. Set is joined by a fearsome cabal of GODS and MEN... THOTH’S VOICE His jealousy corrupted him. Blessed with great cleverness, Set sowed confusion in others. Blessed with great strength, he exploited their weaknesses. (beat) And so the wicked were drawn to Set.

VILLAGERS watch Osiris expectantly... as he plants SEEDS waters them... Vibrant GRAIN SEEDLINGS magically SPROUT.. THOTH’S VOICE Osiris shared his gifts with Men, teaching them to plant and harvest. To make laws and live in peace. In return, Men loved their king. Thankful Villagers bow before Osiris. A sudden WIND blows (CONTINUED)

30s, bronzed skin, his form and features are perfection. ENTERS boldly with a slain lion draped over his shoulder, spoils of his hunt... clutching a jug of wine in his othe hand. He leads a ROWDY band of GODS in celebration... THOTH’S VOICE Osiris had a son, Horus, who was Lord of the Air. (beat) Osiris wished his son would rule at his side... Horus, full of wine, inadvertently tramples the seedlings father planted. THOTH’S VOICE ..-but like the wind, Horus was restless and volatile. ON OSIRIS. Disappointment. He kneels to restore the seedlings his son crushed without even noticing... EXT. OSIRIS’ GARDEN - NIGHT Osiris WALKS in his garden, enjoying the night with his w the Queen:

40s. She radiates power, commanding respect, a goddess ab all other goddesses. Uncompromising in all things -- especially her unyielding love for her husband. THOTH’S VOICE After eons of enmity, Set visited his brother. A strange and disturbing BEAST DARTS from tree to tree be Osiris... It’s like a jackal -- but bigger. A curved snou filled with fangs, square ears, forked tail, and canine b BEHIND Osiris, the beast TRANSFORMS INTO SET. His KNIFE flashes in the darkness... THOTH’S VOICE If Set could not give life, he would take it. Set STABS Osiris in the back. Isis wails as Osiris DIES in her arms. (CONTINUED)

Set places the crown on his head as his CONSPIRATORS surr Osiris’ body... THOTH’S VOICE That night, Set cut Osiris’ body into fourteen pieces. The heart was never found. BLOOD RED BANNERS are raised high... They depict a styliz profile of the beast with a long snout and tall ears. The symbol of Set. The GODS OF OSIRIS’ COURT huddle, cowed in terror. THOTH’S VOICE Gods bowed to Set or fled. Men worshipped him or were enslaved. Over the sound of Isis’ lamentation, WE PUSH IN ON the ba of Set... Until RED FILLS THE FRAME.

Horus kneels at his father’s sarcophagus, grieving... The sound of his mother’s sorrow still lingers, ever-present. THOTH’S VOICE Horus did not know how much he loved his father until it was too late.

The sound of Isis’ crying becomes the WHISTLING WIND... THOTH’S VOICE Years passed. HORUS’ HAND grips a banner of Set... THOTH’S VOICE Those that loved Osiris prayed for his son to return. His hand releases the banner... The wind sucks it away... Toward a distant MOUNTAIN PEAK... The cloth getting small and smaller until it’s just a red speck... THOTH’S VOICE They thought Horus would save them. They thought he would be a wise and just king, like his father. (CONTINUED)

BACKLIT against the sun, Horus pulls a SPEAR from a line spears stuck upright in the ground. His EYES flare, unnaturally bright. Like twin stars, burning as they aim. THOTH’S VOICE But Horus’ Eyes -- eyes that can see everything -- have been focused on only one thing. Horus’ muscled arm cocks back and HURLS the spear... The force parts the air in a SONIC BOOM -- THOTH’S VOICE Vengeance. WE FOLLOW THE SPEAR... Like a missile, it SAILS FOR MILES A blur over forested landscape -- PINNING the BANNER OF S to_a FAR CLIFF. Bulls-eye. ON HORUS. We finally see his face. There is no satisfacti from the feat, only relentless concentration. Horus reaches for another spear -- surprisingly GRABS ONL AIR...
It would be good day to kill him, wouldn't it? Very poetic...
Twirls the spear -- swiped from under Horus’ nose. The Go of Stealth and Horus’ fiercely loyal friend and mentor. L 30s, gray-haired. Squat as a barrel yet quick as a shadow
I hear Set’s celebrating the anniversary of your father’s death with a big festival... Music, dancing. A grand time. ON HORUS. It’s no secret. Horus snatches back his spear..
I’m ready.
You think so?
If I’m not, you’ve been wasting the last ten years. (CONTINUED)

(off the spear) I taught you to throw it straight enough. (prodding) And every time you do, I suppose you picture Set cutting up your father’s body while he forced your mother to watch. Horus’ anger flares. Why is Wepwawet provoking Horus?

But of course you didn't actually see it, did you? You weren't there at all. You were off wandering the earth, being a child. When your father needed a man. The foliage near Horus BURSTS INTO FLAME. We see when Hor gets angry, his body literally RADIATES HEAT.
You know I loved him. I should run you through...

(points at the far cliff) Too easy. Hit the target instead. Horus THROWS his spear again... As he does so, his head CHANGES, for a split second, into that of a FALCON -- His spear MISSES the banner he hit before. Instead, it shears off the side of the far cliff, causing an AVALANCH
A beat of silence between them. It’s clear what the lesso is. Even if the student doesn't want to accept it.
If you fight Set in anger, you'll lose.
The anger will never leave. And I can’t wait that long. Wepwawet slaps Horus on the back, trying to lighten the m
Let this day come and go. Finally Horus nods, agreeing... (CONTINUED)
Horus THROWS his last spear with all his might... As if t could purge years of pent-up grief.

The SONIC BOOM creates a powerful WINDSTORM... THOTH’S VOICE But this is not just a story of Horus’ quest for revenge -- the fate of all Egypt hung in the balance... FOLLOW THE WIND across Egypt... over FIELDS and FORESTS.. THOTH’S VOICE Even the fate of overlooked, unappreciated Man. (beat ) One in particular. Not even I could have imagined he'd help save the immortal land of the gods...
CLOSE ON A YOUNG MAN, passionately kissing a YOUNG WOMAN.
Early 20s. Wiry build. Sharp good looks. A devil-may-care glint in his eye.

Also early 20s. She’s beautiful by any measure, with emer green eyes. Steadfast in her beliefs. We’re too close to see exactly where they are -- but they recline on luxurious pillows... Bek playfully shows Zaya a bottle of PERFUMED OIL...
(off the oil) Real Mendesian. She's impressed. Bek opens the back of her dress, exposin the skin. He kneads the oil into tired muscles...
Yes... Higher... That’s it... (eyes closed, off the oil) Who did you steal it from? (CONTINUED)
An outrageous suggestion.
How about the money to buy it?
(shrugs ) Less outrageous. This is not a thing Zaya approves of, but she’s not judgi
In a different world you’d find an honest trade, right?

In a different world, absolutely. ON BEK. But in this world, not a chance in hell. Bek pulls her on top of him... She squeals, delighted, th covers her mouth. Was she too loud? We REVEAL Bek and Zaya are in a RICHLY APPOINTED OFFICE. pillows arranged in a makeshift bed on the floor... We realize there’s something illicit going on here.
You know we can’t go on like this. It’s too dangerous for you.
(kisses him) It’s worth it. A GUST OF WIND batters the blinds. They both jump, startl
Wind came out of nowhere...

Nothing in Egypt comes from nowhere. (beat) It's Horus. He’s coming to end all this. We SEE the view out the window: A MULTITUDE of men and women toiling... SLAVES. A vast, pitiful tableau of tears, sweat and blood. All to build (CONTINUED)

SET’S GREAT OBELISK It blots out the sun. Millions of tons of rock cut and polished and assembled into a tower still UNDER CONSTRUCT We see the hand of the gods in the uncanny height of the Obelisk... and GIANT SCARAB BEETLES, bigger than elephant laboring as great beasts of burden. All six legs strain against their yokes to raise massive chunks of stone. HIGH WALLS encircle the site. This place is a prison. A familiar sight to Bek and Zaya, but they still hate it.
Sometimes wind is just wind.
(gravely) Not today of all days -- the day Set celebrates his murder of Osiris.
Horus... Set... I couldn’t give a shit about either of them. Zaya’s learned to endure Bek’s blasphemous provocations..
I pity the man who believes in nothing.
(steals a kiss) Never said I believed in nothing. A BELL RINGS out in the construction zone...
Urshu will be coming back to take his meal.
Of what, children? As Zaya straightens her dress, Bek notices a SMALL FIGURI hanging from a cord around her neck. A bright-blue cerami representation of a man with a falcon’s head: Horus.
(off the figurine) I told you to get rid of that. (CONTINUED)
(indignant, hiding it under her collar) You told me? I’m not your servant.

Me being here is dangerous enough. If you’re caught, you’ll be out there in the slave pits. (beat) And on top of everything you carry around an amulet of Horus? An even more ferocious blast of wind KNOCKS open the blin Architectural plans BLOW off the desk and AROUND THE ROOM The SOUND of APPROACHING FOOTSTEPS out in the hall...
(agitated, to Bek) Go. I'll finish. Bek bounds OUT THE WINDOW with startling dexterity. He HA from the window ledge by his fingertips and peers in...

Stalks in with an ENTOURAGE of Overseers. He’s 30s, a for military hero, tasked by Set to oversee construction of t Obelisk. The most feared and envied man in Egypt. Zaya’s cleaning up... This is Urshu’s house... and Zaya i Urshu's servant. Urshu notes his jumbled desk...
(curt, to Zaya) You don’t control the wind. But I'd think you could close a window.
I’m sorry, my lord.
And why is my meal unprepared? As Zaya leaves, Urshu GRIPS her wrist. She grimaces in pa
If I ever find this room disordered again I'll throw you outside to push stone. Zaya nods, terrified of Urshu and EXITS... (CONTINUED)
ll.
Jumps over to the NEXT WINDOW, opening into a HALLWAY. He speaks furtively with Zaya as she leaves Urshu’s office..
This is the last day you’1l be forced to serve him. (beat ) I'm buying you from that bastard.
With what?
At the festival, there’ll be tons of tribute for the king. The idea is beyond comprehension to her.
You plan to rob a god? In his palace? Set can kill you with a touch.
He also has a lot of money.
You've never tried anything like that before.
You don’t know what I’ve tried.
(grips her Horus figurine) Have faith. Bek dismissively waves away the wishful thinking.
Even if Horus comes and puts a spear through Set’s skull -- then what? In Egypt you’re either rich, poor... (off the slaves outside) +..or nothing. Zaya doesn’t have a response. It’s the hard truth.
I choose rich. (CONTINUED)

Bek gives Zaya a last kiss and LEAPS OFF THE WINDOW LEDGE BACK IN URSHU’S OFFICE As the Overseers summarize the day’s progress... Urshu catches sight of an oddly bright dot on the floor... He bends to touch it -- a drop of OIL, reflecting the sun. ON URSHU. Sniffing it. Suspicious.
Mendesian.
Bek EXITS Urshu’s luxurious FOREMAN’S PAVILION... Snatche an untended JUG OF WATER to blend in with the other FREE running errands to and from the FRONT GATE...
Monitor the site. Uniforms emblazoned with Set’s RED SYMB Bek sees a LINE OF NEW SLAVES file through the GATE in chains, fresh labor for the Obelisk...

(to himself) Always someone’s got more than you, but always someone’s got less... Bek hears CRIES OF PAIN and the SIZZLE of burnt flesh. HIGH PRIESTS OF SET stand before burning braziers. They MUTTER incantations. The flames turn an unnatural BLOOD R The Priests heat BRANDING IRONS in the magical flames and BRAND the newcomers’ shoulders, marking them as slaves. NEARBY, a DESPERATE SLAVE in the work zone is delirious w dehydration... Bek inadvertently catches his eye...

(off Bek’s jug of water) Please. ON BEK. He doesn’t want to get involved... but he can’t j leave the guy like this. Bek surreptitiously ROLLS THE JU to the Desperate Slave... A CRUEL OVERSEER’S BOOT comes down on the jug. He scans t crowd to see who sent the water... Bek keeps his head dow (CONTINUED)
The Desperate Slave’s last bit of hope empties into the d He makes a MAD DASH for the GATE -- and accidentally COLL with Bek...
(voice low to the Slave) Don’t. You bear Set’s brand. You're cursed now. The Slave won’t listen. He runs wildly, PASSING the Gate
You can’t leave -- The burnt flesh of the Slaves’s brand SPREADS ACROSS HIS like a cancer. The dark magic turns the slave to DUST. This is “Set’s Curse.” For the branded, there is no way out...
ON BEK. Repulsed. But that’s the way of things. He has other, more pressing concerns...
(waving Bek through) Enjoy the festival.

The capital of Egypt sits on the banks of the mighty NILE Merchant ships crowd the river like an ancient superhighw It's as if Manhattan were carved from marble then gilt in gold. Engineering beyond anything we associate with the ancient world. Brand new pyramids shine, smooth as glass. And towering over everything, like a buttress supporting sky, is Set’s Obelisk.

A long procession of WEALTHY NOBLES steadily move up a GR AVENUE lined on both sides by towering golden statues... Toward the palace GATE. There’s anticipation in the air for the FESTIVAL celebrat Set’s defeat of Osiris, those names on everyone's lips. The POOR are pressed along the avenue... They stare longingly at the privileged wealthy as they pass... ON BEK. Amongst the throng of poor. His expression isn't exactly longing, but that of a hunter locked on his quarr (CONTINUED)
A caravan of tribute loaded with every TREASURE imaginabl CHESTS of GOLD, IVORY, LAPIS and PRECIOUS STONES.
A simple FISHERMAN elbows Bek, making conversation.
Imagine having all that...
I can.

A grand, open-air “Hypostyle” COURTYARD that seats hundre It’s surrounded by row after row of colossal PILLARS like forest of stone. AT THE GATE, Bek enters with the crowd... A broad-shouldered HOODED MAN walks with purpose, accidentally shoulder-checking Bek.

Watch it. The Hooded Man MOVES ON without noticing. Bek sniffs. Rud REVEAL the Hooded Man is Horus... Bek DARTS stealthily behind a pillar, avoiding the watchf eyes of SOLDIERS... Bek’s fingertips find seams in the limestone as he CLIMBS... No one the wiser. Osiris’ glittering Palace has changed since we last saw i Now the seat of Set’s power. His ARMED SOLDIERS are everywhere. RED BANNERS drape from the marble heights. Th look like never-ending streams of blood.

Sits on a THRONE on a raised dais. Implacable. NOBLES file by Set’s feet. Bow deeply. In fear. In awe. Blessed to be in his presence. Set does not look at them, nor the TREASURES they bear. He is consumed by his own thoughts.

Laughs. A sound beautiful as summer raindrops. The beautiful Goddess of Love, Music, and Alcohol, 20s, styli in a turquoise sheath dress. She sits close to Set, her h on his knee. The most desirable woman anyone has ever see (CONTINUED)
(flicking her hair) How can you ignore such treasure? Hathor is speaking of herself, of course, and Set knows i

Today has a single purpose. She's a perfect beauty. Perfect company. But we sense it’ a mask. We can’t see what’s going on behind her eyes. Festival-goers crowd in... MUSICIANS play pipes and drums DANCERS SHAKE ceremonial rattles -- and everything else,
(to Set) You really think he’s going to come? After all this time?
(dry) ; I’m honoring his father. How can he not?
HOPS from PILLAR TO PILLAR in a chain of death-defying leaps... Moving toward the PILE OF TRIBUTE...
The music STOPS. Time for the entertainment to begin. An ORATOR sets the stage for today’s performance...

(speaking to the crowd) Today we mark the ascension of our King to Egypt’s throne... as we celebrate the downfall of craven Osiris at his hand. A brutish actor/warrior playing “OSIRIS” stalks out into courtyard. The Audience BOOS... Another actor/warrior plays “Set.” He wears a RED HELMET that looks like a strange LONG-SNOUTED BEAST with sharp e
Witness, fine lords and glorious gods, a reenactment of the supreme Lord Set’s brave vanquishing of the wretched pretender to the crown. (CONTINUED)
The Nobles in the stands wait expectantly for the action. No less excited are a congress of

Chattering in low tones, lest they offend Set. They look like idealized humans, above lowly mankind. Notable among them a GOD OF VIRILITY with the personality of a Donkey. humorless HARVEST GODDESS. And

A bullish God of Butchers. Head of Set’s Palace security. There's also a HALF-DOZEN BABOONS off to the side of Set’ throne. They hunch over papyrus scrolls, busily writing d what they see. One Baboon accidentally spills his ink... staining Mnevis sandal. Mnevis draws a sword to slay the offending creatu
Mnevis -- it is my guest.
The God of Wisdom was your guest. He sent baboons.
Thoth prefers his own company.
(to the crowd) Behold the liberation of our splendid Egypt! “Osiris” ATTACKS “Set.” “Set” fights back in self-defense A mockery of the true events. The Audience is riveted.
This isn’t the story I remember.
One of the spoils of victory is chronicling your opponent's defeat. And the cruder the performance, the more likely Horus will be baited.
Watches the “entertainment” from the shadows BEHIND THE STANDS. Anger building... (CONTINUED)
Bek DANGLES like a spider over the PILE OF TREASURE. Belo the GUARDS are distracted by the show... But a PORTLY PRI hovers over the gifts, cataloguing them.

Bek scoops a fingerful of accumulated DUST from atop a column... Lets it DRIFT DOWN... The Portly Priest SNEEZES... giving Bek the chance to silently DROP behind the treasure. Bek fills his pockets with jewelry. But there’s only so much he can carry... Bek’s eyes a fancy CHARIOT... It’ll fit the bill nicely.
The “Set” actor WINS, pinning the “Osiris” actor beneath boot. CELEBRATION ERUPTS at “Set’s victory.” The God of Virility BRAYS. A fine show, indeed.
Has seen enough. He takes a step toward the throne... A HAND clamps down on Horus’ shoulder --
(voice low) This is what he wants. It's Wepwawet. Also disguised. Horus is surprised to see him -- and irritated to be caught by his teacher.
Let’s get out of here while we can. With a colossal act of will, Horus FOLLOWS Wepwawet away.
On his throne. His eyes searching the crowd, disappointed
Oh well. Guess you’1l have to wait another ten years.
I’m not finished. Set steps INTO THE COURTYARD. The audience watches with bated breath... as Set circles the trembling “Osiris.” (CONTINUED)
(addressing all present) It is important that the manner of Osiris’ death be known... That the scribes mark the record true. The Actor “Osiris” weeps with fear, GROVELLING at Set’s f
Osiris begged before dying.
Horus stops in his tracks. Seething...
Keep walking...
Touches the “Osiris” Actor... The man DRIES into a mummif husk, shrivelling like salt poured on a slug. The body tu to dust. Same fate as the cursed slave at the Obelisk...
No King of Egypt should beg.
Is pushed to the limit. He throws off his cloak, uncoveri a clutch of SPEARS --
Don’t --
Senses something --

STREAKS at him like a missile. It creases Set’s ear, as h barely DODGES out of the way -- The God of Virility, however, is PINNED TO A PILLAR. Horus strides into the courtyard, SPEAR in each fist... T eyes of Osiris’ son burn with vengeance. A hush falls...
Today I bring truth. Today I avenge my father for the evil done to him. (CONTINUED)

ON BEK. Seeing Horus in the flesh for the first time, he can’t help but be in awe. ON THE NOBLES. Whispering in fear, “He’s come.” ON THE LESSER GODS. Nervous they’ve chosen the wrong side ON THE LOWER CLASSES, peering in from outside. Their savi is here. ON HATHOR. She catches Horus’ eye. There’s history here. He sees her as an enemy. She doesn’t see him that way -- won't let it show. Set grips his SCEPTER, a deadly 5,000 pound iron monstros
I was hoping my nephew was coming to swear his eternal devotion. (a half smile, to Horus) It’s not too late to bow before me.
I’1l bow to your dust. It begins. Their WEAPONS CLANG loud as a thousand swords.
(genuinely impressed) I mistook your absence for cowardice. But you’ve been practicing. Lesser gods JUMP ASIDE. Mnevis draws his sword halfway... then stops. All afraid of Horus.
(to the lesser gods) Now, later... it doesn't matter. Horus ferociously CHARGES -- sends Set BACKPEDALING into

Bek SCAMPERS UP A PILLAR like a monkey to get out of the way... Priests and Nobles run hither and thither... Horus SHOULDERS PILLARS ASIDE like a battering ram... The gods’ fierce duel takes them RIGHT BELOW BEK. His high perch TOTTERS like a gargantuan bowling pin... (CONTINUED)
Bek LEAPS onto another pillar. Safe until a mighty swing Set’s scepter CRACKS that pillar, too.
Oh come on. High above the clashing titans, Bek BOUNDS from pillar to pillar as they fall like dominoes... Bek eyes the CHARIOT OF TREASURE below -- at least the go combat scattered the Soldiers...
Bek SLIDES DOWN a tipping pillar like a ramp... HOPS A RI on another pillar about to grind him to a pulp... .».-and drops TO THE FLOOR, next to the Chariot.
Loses sight of Set in the maze of Pillars... Now he hunts But every time he has a bead on Set, he’s GONE the second Horus STRIKES. Set is everywhere and nowhere...
I thought your sight was perfect, but you aim like a drunk.

God of Confusion, I can see everything. HORUS’ P.O.V. Looking through the pillars with X-RAY VISI Sees multiple Sets -- but only one casts _a_shadow. His vision focuses to a narrow beam, pinpointing his target - Horus THROWS. The SPEAR flies true -- It punches through two pillars on its way to Set, STRIKIN HIM IN THE CHEST. Set FALLS. The CROWD GASPS. Nobles, in horror. The poor, exultantly.
Die god of rot. Your body will be given to the cats, and the offal cast to the reptiles. But Set RISES, very much alive. SNAPS the spear.
(stunned) Why aren't you dead? (CONTINUED)
Maybe you should have practiced more. ON HORUS. It makes no sense. Frustration fans his anger.
STRAPS the Chariot’s BRIDLE around his shoulders.
Second thing I’m going to buy is a horse... Bek hears an inhuman screech. He thought he’d seen it all Horus transforms into a GREAT FALCON.

Set responds by becoming the massive, four-legged JACKAL- CREATURE. Wings beating, the Falcon digs CLAWS into its f Bek DUCKS as the god-beasts GRAPPLE... It’s only a matter moments before the whole temple collapses. Bek PULLS the chariot like a mule, teeth gritted -- but t Portly Priest and two SOLDIERS block his way.
You're a thief.

And you're a priest. (looks him in the eye) The question is, which one of us is more committed to his job? A chunk of stone HITS right beside them. The Portly Pries and Soldiers RUN. So much for commitment. Bek throws his weight into the bridle as pillars SMASH DO all around him. He HEAVES the Chariot, threads the needle
As the whole structure comes CRASHING DOWN. Bek made it.

From out of the wreckage, the Jackal-Creature CLAMPS its on the Falcon and FLINGS it into the giant PALACE GATE. The Falcon TRANSFORMS back to HORUS, getting his bearings The impact CRACKED the GATE... If it falls, it’1ll hit Be chariot of treasure. (CONTINUED)
Bek sees a NOBLEWOMAN near Horus, her dress pinned by RUB

(to Horus) Help me... Horus RUSHES Set, oblivious to the Noblewoman and her fat The stone gate TEETERS -- she’s sure to be crushed -- Bek makes a split-second decision. He pulls the Noblewoma OUT OF THE WAY as the Gate starts to FALL...
Thank you, kind sir -- But Bek’s already RUNNING BACK to the chariot. LUGS IT ou of the way in the nick of time as the Gate HITS -- The Noblewoman pats at her throat. Her NECKLACE is missin
Casually tosses the necklace he just stole into the chari adding it to the rest of his treasure.
In human form again, backs down the avenue lined with towering GOLDEN STATUES of Ra. Baiting Horus to follow...
With no father to protect you, your mother came to me one night. Willing to do anything to keep you safe... Anything at all...
Shut up... As Horus’ fury grows, heat distorts the air around him...
Which, it turned out, was quite a lot.
Shut _up. As super-heated Horus pursues his enemy, cloth banners BU INTO FLAME at his passing... Set smirks as Horus gets angrier and angrier. (CONTINUED)

Wrath thy name is Horus. And by thy name undone. Horus feels a DROP on his shoulder. It’s MOLTEN GOLD. The giant golden statues are MELTING from Horus’ heat. Th crumple like soft wax on top of him... He’s KNOCKED DOWN the weight... Set STRIKES him with the full might of his scepter. Horus FLIES BACK in a spray of liquid gold -- Horus STRUGGLES to rise, but Set HAMMERS him... until Hor lies defeated. Set reaches down... And PLUCKS out both of Horus’ EYES. Horus’ eyes appear as JEWELS glinting magically in Set’s fist. A theft of Horus’ very essence.

(addressing the crowd) Even though I was provoked, Horus still lives. I am Set the merciful. Horus CRAWLS AWAY, BLINDED... gold running like a stream around him... ON HATHOR. A thousand emotions flash across her face befo she successfully feigns disinterest... ON WEPWAWET. His worst fears have come to pass. THE CROWD is stunned. Even Set’s faithful are staggered b what’s transpired. For the Lower Classes, all hope is gon
(to himself) This is why praying’s a waste of time. Bek COVERS his treasure with a torn banner and ROLLS IT A
Dense forest. Horus CRAWLS, seeing only with his fingertips... his eyes BLINDFOLDED with torn cloth.
(to the North Winds) Father... I failed. (CONTINUED)
Horus pounds the ground in frustration. Trees tremble.

CLOSE ON A HAMMER brought down on an ANVIL -- each blow bright as a meteor strike. A HELMET has been forged. The metal glows red as blood spilled by hate. Set admires his handiwork... and fits ON JEWELED EYE of Horus into the faceplate.
Finally. The Right Eye of Horus.

Wepwawet follows a TRAIL OF DESTRUCTION, accompanied by S OTHER GODS in the form of athletic men and women... Allie of Horus. They see crops flattened. Boulders split. A granary reduc to rubble. Like a tornado cut a path through the farmland FARMERS hurry past, fleeing the source of the mayhem.

Turn back. He’s mad... Horus’ Allies keep following the trail... They find Horus on the move, blindly swinging his fists. Horus rips off branches, stiff-arms trunks into SPLINTERS. His eyes wrapped with a BLINDFOLD torn from his tunic.
Easy, Horus... Horus HALTS, recognizing the voice. There’s nowhere to go anyway. Hot, impotent rage withers the grass at his feet.
My anger did not defeat me. (baffled) He withstood a mortal blow from my spear... I don’t know how. Wepwawet does not want to provoke him by arguing the poin
Set’s trickery is famed. Wepwawet presses a bottle into Horus’ hand. Horus takes a drink. It calms him an iota. (CONTINUED)

Hey. Zaya turns to see Bek standing next to her. She gasps.
(off the Overseer) Pretty good distraction if you didn't even notice me... There’s no time to celebrate their reunion. Zaya rubs her shoulder. The brand’s still there.
Set’s not dead... Bek puts Hathor’s bracelet on Zaya’s wrist... (CONTINUED)
Doesn’t matter. Bek leads her away, heads down, while everyone else’s eye are on the Overseer...
Sees the disorder in the slave area... But Urshu is not s easily fooled. He looks elsewhere... .-..and spots Bek and Zaya. They’re headed toward the Gat
Reach the threshold of the gate. Bek RUNS PAST. Zaya STOP afraid. Stepping past will trigger the curse...
Trust me. Zaya closes her eyes... and WALKS OUT OF THE GATE... Immediately, the BRAND on Zaya’s shoulder BLOOMS WITH DEC
Bek... The bracelet SHINES BRIGHT, repelling the dark corruption completely ERASING THE BRAND. Zaya’s eyes go wide with wonderment. Her curse is lifted.
Told you I’d save you. They JUMP IN the waiting chariot -- FSSST. What was that sound? One of the horses snorting, ready to speed them away?
(turns to Zaya) Let's go... Bek sees an ARROW buried in Zaya’s chest.
She sinks onto the chariot floor.
Zaya? (CONTINUED)
For a moment that seems endless, Bek doesn’t know what to
Stands with a BOW. He coldly notches another ARROW and shoots again --

WHISPERS into the horse’s ear. They TAKE OFF -- Urshu’s second arrow IMPACTS A WALL where the chariot was Now just swirling dust. Bek cradles Zaya in his arms in the moving chariot. The world around them a blur.
Horus stalks forward, furious. They’ve now reached the RE SANDS of Set’s land... Hathor and Thoth lag behind.
He’1ll meet the fate earned by all traitors.
You could have averted this.
I’1l do it without him. Thoth is about to contradict this falsehood... then think better of it. THE CHARIOT speeds out of nowhere. Comes to a HALT.
(to Bek, livid) If you’ve come to beg, you may begin.
Can you help her? The gods see Zaya barely clinging to life. Thoth examines her... but it’s clear to Horus her condition is dire. Hathor gives Zaya a sip from her wineskin.
I can take away her pain. (CONTINUED)
Zaya relaxes, soothed by Hathor’s drink. But her breathin is shallow. She’s fading...
(to Bek) I’m glad we’re together. Zaya’s eyes close... A final exhale...
I can’t feel her heart... (to Horus) Save her.
We can’t. ON HORUS. He knows what he needs to do.

(in a quiet voice) Come to me, O Mighty Isis. A mournful CRY pierces the air. A majestic bird, a KITE, swoops down, transforming into ISIS. The wife of Osiris stands before them in all her majesty. The gods take a knee before her... Isis turns up her nose at Hathor like she’s a cheap tramp.
(to Horus) By what right do you summon me? The one who widowed me remains upon my husband’s throne.
I know. Isis rests her palm on Horus’ empty eye, disapproving.

How I wish I had other sons who could honor their father, but Set robbed us of them before they could be born. I only have you. Isis finally notices Bek. He’s distraught, beside the bod of the woman he loves.
Help him, mother. (CONTINUED)
Bek bows before Isis, tear-streaked face in the dirt. It’ heart-rending.

Please... Isis sees Bek’s tears... and her own eyes well with emoti Isis cradles Zaya in the crook of her arm, gently plucks the arrow. Isis cups her hand to her own mouth, and exhal life into her palm. It’s BRIGHT as the noon sun. Isis presses her life-force into Zaya’s chest. The wound seals. Zaya seems to glow from within... Isis WHISPERS in her ear, gentle but insistent... Bek silently prays... The glow fades from Zaya’s body. Isis turns sadly to Bek.
She has passed beyond where I can reach her.

But you’re a goddess... Isis’ shoulders sag under the weight of another defeat. Another death. Horus’ fists clench with helpless grief. Hathor tears up. Thoth bows his head in respect. Bek sits in the dirt, staring vacantly. He’s empty. Isis removes her own silky cape to wrap the dead Zaya, cocooning her in a BURIAL SHROUD worthy of a god.
May she find the joy denied to us. Isis transforms and FLIES AWAY, alone once more. Bek hands Hathor the bracelet he stole...
Punish me.
That’s not what I do. Horus PUNCHES a nearby cliff side... creating a small CAV (CONTINUED)

She needs to be buried. INT. ZAYA’S TOMB The proper burial HIEROGLYPHICS are inscribed on the cave walls. Zaya’s wrapped body is laid in state. Thoth waves incense... The smoke does not rise. It burrow into the earth...
O thou who art Everlasting, send your servant Anubis to guide the dead to new life. A PASSAGE OPENS in the SMOKY VEIL cloaking the floor...

Rises. The intimidating guide to the Afterlife. A JACKAL’ HEAD with fur black as the grave. A man’s body, taut and sinewy. Yet his eyes are strangely calming, promising absolute peace. ON BEK. Unnerved... Anubis nods to the gods, who return the courtesy. Hathor puts her BRACELET on Zaya’s wrist.
You would give her that?
Of course. Anubis touches the bracelet, and a SMOKY OUTLINE OF THE TREASURE flows down into the passage...
(to Zaya’s body) She is made mighty before Ra. She shall enter the hidden gate with power. Anubis reaches into the shrouded body as if it were intangible, and PULLS OUT ZAYA by the hand.
(to Zaya’s body) You are released. (CONTINUED)
At first glance, Zaya seems alive... but her skin has a s movement to it as well...
Zaya -- But Zaya can’t hear him. She can only see that which lies before her...

The doors of earth are opened to you. Anubis leads Zaya DOWN THE PASSAGE opened in the floor... The path tunnels into the darkness of ANOTHER DIMENSION.. TWELVE GATES mark the path -- ancient arches hewn from st older than time. Each Gate must be passed to reach the wa bright LIGHT at the end. ON BEK. The light is beautiful, beckoning in the distance Anubis LEADS Zaya by the hand toward the First Gate... ON HORUS, looking at Bek losing his love forever... There must be something he can do... Maybe there is.
Anubis, who directs your path?
He who wears the crown of Egypt rules all Egypt.
If I take the crown from Set, I can command you to turn back?
If I have not yet escorted her through the Twelfth Gate, she may return. But no one may leave the Afterlife once entered.
How long?
The journey takes twelve hours, one for every hour of the night.
Do me a favor. Walk slowly. (CONTINUED)
As slowly as I dare. The smoke BLOWS AWAY, erasing the passage. Zaya is gone.
(to Bek) If Set is slain before Zaya reaches her journey’s end, I can bring her back to you. ON BEK. A rush of determination. And hope.

Horus, Bek, Hathor and Thoth trudge through a SANDSTORM.. Can’t see more than a few inches in front of them... All at once the storm CLEARS as they reach the calm eye i the center of this hurricane... SET’S TEMPLE A massive PYRAMID. It seems smooth and sharp-edged... but it’s made of blood red SAND held together by Set’s magic. The Pyramid’s surface is in constant motion, as if each g of sand were alive... The grinding movement is as deafeni as a waterfall. They MOVE CLOSE enough for grains of sand to spit off and bite their cheeks... but Bek can’t see any visible openin Then the sand parts, opening a DOORWAY into the Pyramid.. After a moment it’s erased. ANOTHER DOOR OPENS, then CLOSES... A repeating invitation...
I was here once...
Did you go in one of those doors?
It was late. I was drunk. Hathor would rather not talk about it...
Set told me to keep close or I'd never get out. I thought I was going to be crushed, but I followed him to a big metal wheel... (MORE) (CONTINUED)
He turned it, and just like that, everything went still. ON BEK. How to get in? The Pyramid’s doors continually OP and CLOSE... Beckoning just long enough to seem like a re option...
(to Horus) How long have we got? Horus focuses his eye beyond our earthly realm... HORUS’ P.O.V. Zaya and Anubis walk under another arch on Afterlife path...
She passes the Eleventh Gate. Be quick. Bek studies the pattern of doors opening and closing... H sees the answer. Maybe.
Ever seen the shell game? (they haven't) We mortals use it to swindle coins from fools. Three shells, pick the right one and you win. Only you can’t win. It’s fixed. Bek hopes he’s right...
See you inside. Bek IGNORES the opening and closing doors. Instead, Bek SPRINTS straight at the Pyramid’s WALL --

Hathor grips Horus’ wrist -- she thinks Bek’s going to di Bek RUNS THROUGH THE WALL like a knife through a red woun INT. SET’S TEMPLE OF SHIFTING SAND Bek’s in a cavernous, disorienting SPACE out of M.C. Esch nightmares. Millions of tons of sand flowing in a mad architecture of ARCHWAYS, STAIRWAYS and BRIDGES... Formin into SOLID STONE for a moment... than reverting back into rivers of sand. Ahead, Bek sees THE WHEEL Hathor mentioned -- the mechani that shuts off the Pyramid’s shifting sand. (CONTINUED)

The Wheel is the only thing not moving, attached to a sol post like the steering wheel on a ship. Bek feels a rush of euphoria. Maybe this is going to work The floor begins to DISINTEGRATE underfoot --

A FLIGHT OF STAIRS sails past... No time to think about i He LEAPS ONTO THE STAIRS... BOUNDS UP as steps MELT behin him... At the top, Bek has a choice between TWO identical BRIDGE straddling the swirling space... But which one?

Roll the bones... Bek SPRINTS onto one BRIDGE... as the other BRIDGE is SWE AWAY in an eddy of sand. Lucky, lucky. He’s still alive, but this is not sustainable. Bek LEAPS from SOLID ROCK to SOLID ROCK... He glimpses th Wheel through the flowing maze. Before it’s gobbled up again, Bek JUMPS OFF THE EDGE --

ONTO A STONE ARCH. He holds on... riding the arch like a wave. Just before it crumbles he JUMPS one last time... FALLING through the red void -- Bek GRABS onto the Wheel for dear life. BUFFETED on all sides... Bek won’t let go. He manages to CRANK the WHEEL
All at once the sand of Set’s Pyramid turns SOLID --
Horus, Hathor and Thoth ENTER from a HALLWAY that’s now j normal stone.
(slaps Bek on the back) Well done.

(cracks his knuckles) Which way to the Sphinx? INT. INNER CHAMBER - SET’S PYRAMID Horus, Hathor, Thoth and Bek ENTER a great CHAMBER. Lit f below by flickering FIRELIGHT. Horus girds himself, spear raised... as SOMETHING HUGE emerges from the shadows: (CONTINUED)
Stares down. The head of an implacable man in royal headdress, atop the fearsome body of a lion. Golden fur rippling. Spiked tail swaying...
Trespassers in the house of the king, answer my riddle or cease to be. Horus confronts the Sphinx himself.
Why do you serve that murderous backstabber?
A riddle for me, son of Osiris? (answers matter-of-fact) I serve the king.
You were created to serve Egypt.
Egypt and the King are one. (beat) Now answer my riddle, or cease to be.
Go on. I’m waiting. The Sphinx focuses its menace on Thoth. Asks its riddle:

I never was, am always to be. No one ever saw me, nor ever will. And yet I am the confidence of all who live and breathe. (beat) What am I? Seconds tick by as Thoth thinks... Horus, Bek and Hathor wait...
(with certainty) Order. You are order. The Sphinx ATTACKS Thoth, blindingly fast -- (CONTINUED)
Horus GRAPPLES the Sphinx, fur in his fists, barely preventing Thoth’s decapitation. Hathor and Bek dodge the Sphinx’s WHIPPING TAIL...
(to Thoth) Try... again... please...
That was a completely suitable answer. (to the Sphinx) You are... purity. Wrong. The Sphinx SLAMS Horus into the wall with earthqua force. Thoth racks his brain. Rattled now, off his game.

“I never was, am always to be. No one ever saw me, nor ever will.” (stream of consciousness) In the future. Nonexistent. Yet it exists. Ephemeral. Imaginary. Horus braces his forearm under the beast’s chin, JAWS inc from his face... Its tail LASHES HIM... Horus can’t keep this up long... Hathor and Bek can only watch...
“And yet I am the confidence of all who live and breathe.” Live and breathe... Live and breathe...
Stop thinking like a god.
(snaps ) Then I might as well stop thinking. Thoth glances at Bek. Clarity coming...
What is the confidence of mortals? Their lives are so short, but their hope remains undimmed for... for... The Sphinx finally FLINGS Horus aside... It rears up, rea to slay Thoth -- (CONTINUED)
(answers the riddle) You are tomorrow. The Sphinx sinks to all fours and TURNS TO STONE. Do we detect relief on its face? Fairly defeated, it no longer must serve Set.

Ha! I am Thoth, God of Knowledge, Master of Truth. Horus advances to A VOLCANIC PIT. It seems to go down forever. It is the primordial fire that begat the desert sands... Horus kneels at the edge and unslings his flask, filled w WATER OF CREATION...
Do it. Horus POURS the water into the pit... In moments, the fir will be doused, and Set’s power with it... But the water merely splashes onto SOLID GROUND. Wasted.
(confused) What? Where’s the pit? The room seems to warp... Horus staggers, his senses CONFOUNDED... Bek and Hathor a DISORIENTED, too... Horus realizes they’re in a trap.
He’s here. ON THOTH. He stops short, stunned: Set stands before him. He appeared out of nowhere.

You are Thoth, God of Fools. Set magically punches his hand though Thoth’s forehead an pulls out his BRAIN. Thoth’s essence looks like smooth bl LAPIS in Set’s hand. Thoth crumples, BABBLING NONSENSE. Horus squints in Set’s direction... unable to get a bead him. Set’s POWER OF CONFUSION has addled his sight... (CONTINUED)
(to Horus) Thank you. You lured Thoth from his library so I didn’t have to. Set secures Thoth’s brain into its place on his HELMET.
The final piece. Set stands back and beholds his terrible masterpiece. The ARMOR gleams with the spellbinding power of the gods.
Why steal so much power? You’re already stronger than anyone, except... (realizing, alarmed) Ra. For this is Set’s true target...

Ra had two sons... but he only granted one the power to give life. (bitterly) Unlike Osiris, I can never have a child. My children are nothing but wind and sand. Horus has to snap himself out of Set’s spell... He slides his palm down the BLADE of his SPEAR. Welcoming the PAIN.

You are a failure, but at least my brother had someone to seek vengeance in his name. All I am will end with me... So I choose never to end. I will take Ra‘’s place in eternity. The pain allows Horus to see Set clearly: Set seizes Hathor and drags her to the actual pit -- Horus THROWS HIS SPEAR at Set -- the best aim he can must But it only glances Set’s cheek.
(to Hathor) I’ll miss the wine. Set FLINGS Hathor OVER THE EDGE OF THE PIT -- (CONTINUED)
No -- Horus DIVES after her --
FALLING... Horus GRABS Hathor, both plummeting toward the FIRE at the center of the world. Horus GRABS a jutting ledge of STONE. Horus and Hathor ha on for their very existence...
(to Horus) Don’t let go...
Casually glances down... Horus hugs Hathor to his chest.. KICKS a TOEHOLD. JAMS FINGERS into STONE. He CLIMBS, inch by inch... But it’s clear he’s already lost.
Leans his shoulder against Set’s armor, pushing it to the edge of the pit... It totters precariously. Another shove and it’1ll fall in.
(to Set) This important to you? Bek has Set’s undivided attention.
Stop. (re: Horus) Why would you fight a god’s war?
Maybe he’s my friend...
Or maybe you have a deal with him. (probing) The girl who walks with Anubis? Set can see he’s right.
It’s too late. (CONTINUED)
You're lying.

Look into the Eye. Bek stares into the “Eye of Horus” GEMSTONE on the Helmet Its magic allows Bek to see into the beyond... BEK’'S P.O.V. Set is telling the truth. Anubis guides Zay through the Twelfth and final Gate. She DISAPPEARS into t light of the Afterlife. Bek is undone by sadness, the ARMOR SLIPPING in his grip.
Spare my armor, and I will help you.
(hollow) You can’t.

No King of Egypt can bring her back, now or ever... But I can make you wealthy enough to buy your way into the Afterlife. (beat) Only there can you be reunited with your love. ON HORUS, down in the pit... still a long way to climb...
(shouts up to Bek) Don’t. ON BEK. In the depths of despair, he makes his choice: Bek pulls the armor back from the edge and gives it to Se
Unlike some, my oath is good. ON HORUS. His anger at Bek blazes hot as the fire below.
You white-livered mortal...
Stands beside Bek. Bek’s shoulders bow. A broken man. (CONTINUED)
Set waves his hand -- and a WALL DISSIPATES... Revealing HOARD OF TREASURE.
My temple shall be your burial chamber. Now you may pay Anubis, and find the way open. Set hands Bek a bejeweled DAGGER... Bek stares at it numb

If you haven’t the stomach for it, just wait a moment... Set gestures at the roof. Obeying his spell, the Pyramid SHUDDERS. In a few minutes it will collapse... Set EXITS with his ARMOR. ON BEK. Forlorn. Fine showers of sand already falling...
(bitterly, off the treasure) Always wanted a big funeral. Bek positions the knife over his heart... None of this is right and he knows it...

(to himself) Just close your eyes and do it. Bek puts everything out of his mind. Stop thinking about what you've done... Countdown to suicide: three, two... Horus SWATS away the knife before Bek can drive it in --
The Son of Osiris BURNS, wreathed in the FIRE of his ange
You denied me my vengeance...
Horus, don’t -- Horus SHOVES the treasure INTO THE PIT. It melts to nothingness. With this vindictive act, Horus denies Bek t Afterlife.
(to Bek) You will never see your love now. (CONTINUED)
Horus is surprised Bek does not rage back, or plead. has something to get off his chest.

The night I lost Zaya to the slavers, I didn’t know what to do. I was lost. So I called out to you. To save her. And me. (beat) Growing up, I thought you were the bravest thing in all creation. So I hated you for not coming to our rescue. Horus doesn’t know how to react to this...
I didn’t hear.
No, you didn't listen. 95. But Bek A section of the ceiling falls behind them... Soon the wh place will come tumbling down... Bek sits and waits to di

(despairing) I’ve finally learned the lesson of the gods. We don’t matter to you. Even if we wish we did. ON HORUS. Profoundly moved. Here is this mortal, so fragi and yet so strong. But the selfish actions of the gods -- especially Horus -- have crushed Bek’s spirit. Horus’ anger subsides. The flames WITHER AWAY. Molten san cools to red glass.
You do matter. Horus humbly TAKES A KNEE before Bek.
I am sorry. ON BEK. Of all the improbable things he’s seen, Horus on bended knee is the least likely.
Perhaps one day you’1l forgive me. (CONTINUED)
We've both made mistakes. Avalanches of sand COMING DOWN all around them now...

Then there’s much we still must do. But first, I swear you will not be buried here. Horus spots the GIANT WHEEL through crumbling walls... an TEARS IT OFF ITS POST. Hathor scoops up Thoth’s body... Horus holds the Wheel over their heads like a shield...
Stay close -- The entire Pyramid of sand comes CRASHING DOWN around the ON HORUS, muscles straining against the thundering downpour... Until we can see only RED.
The Great Obelisk stands like a colossal stone sword. Now FINISHED, stabbing the heavens... Set is pleased. Urshu, the Overseers, and thousands of Slaves bow before him.
(addressing the Slaves) Your task is complete at the hour I demanded. You have earned a great honor. Overseers force the Slaves INSIDE THE OBELISK...
You will serve me for eternity. Set slides a massive slab across the door, sealing them i
Slaves POUND desperately against unyielding stone. Envelo in DARKNESS. The Older Woman Slave drops to her knees...
_. (praying) . ; Hail Horus, Son of Osiris, he with golden eyes like the noonday sun. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
We are your followers. Please deliver us.
Why pray? He isn’t coming.

At the Obelisk’s high peak, the evening sky’s purple cano is close enough to touch... Set fastens his ARMOR. Dons his helmet. Extends his wings As the SUN dips to the horizon... Ra’s boat sails ABOVE h Set LAUNCHES himself off the Obelisk. FLIES like a GLIDER Air currents silently lift his wings through the darkenin sky, toward Ra’s boat... EXT. RA’S BOAT - DUSK Ra cranks out the last links of the chain to the sun... letting his boat drift into DARKNESS. He stands at the bo spear ready... Set LANDS quietly behind Ra... and pulls his cloak around himself to conceal the armor. Set gazes down at the shimmering NILE...
(off the view) It was never supposed to be so green. Ra turns at Set’s voice -- surprised to see him.
Set. It must have taken great effort to get up here. You always were clever.
How else could we speak? You do not let your feet touch Egypt’s sand.
Your contendings with Horus are not my concern. Leave me to prepare for my nightly chore. Movement in the deep as Ra’s boat nears the demon Apophis (CONTINUED)
You have nothing more to say? Much history has been written since last we spoke.

You came all this way to hear my words? Hear them then, and carry them in your heart. (harsh) If my feet were on Egypt’s sand, Osiris would not have been the son who died. ON SET. It cuts deep, even after all that’s come to pass. The echo of Apophis’ starved GROWL shakes the boat...
(to Set) Now go. The hour comes for me to turn back chaos.
Why? Set brandishes his scepter... Ra turns on Set with fury..

You raise your arm against me? Ra STRIKES the upstart Set with a BLAST OF SOLAR FIRE fro his spear. BURNING LIGHT envelops Set... Ra watches with emotion the seeming death of his son at his own hand. But as the light dims, Set REMAINS STANDING.
No god could withstand that...

I’m not just one god. Set’s cloak has burned away, revealing the ARMOR beneath. the jeweled body parts still hot with Ra’s light. Set HAMMERS Ra with his scepter -- Ra tumbles OFF THE BOAT, stunned, into the OCEAN OF DARKNESS... (CONTINUED)
Apophis, quench your thirst. The darkness UNCOILS...

A FIST punches up from the sand... Horus RISES, helps up Hathor. Bek behind them. They all gulp in cool night air. The STONE SPHINX is revealed, half-buried, rising from th desert floor... Where it can still be seen to this day. What looks like a BRIGHT STAR falls from the heavens... R
(re: Set) He did it. At the far rim of the world, a BLACKNESS darker than nigh brewing...
The Older Woman Slave still prays... Around her, moans an the occasional sob. The air in the Obelisk is running out

(weakly) Hail Horus, Son of Osiris... He with golden eyes like the noonday sun... We are your... followers. Please... From outside, a FIST hammers through the stone... LIGHT pours in... Slaves blink at the radiance...
(from outside) I hear you...
Horus smashes OPEN the DOOR...
...and you shall be freed. Bek watches the Slaves RUN OUT OF THE OBELISK... their fa shining with gratitude. (CONTINUED)
That was a great thing you did.
I did what any king would do for his people. ON BEK. Did Horus just say “king?”
Thought you didn’t want to be king?
(clasps Bek’s shoulder) I just hadn’t gotten to know my people. Horus radiates a power and grandeur Bek’s never seen in h before.

(off the Slaves) They won’t truly be free until Set’s curse is cleansed from their flesh. Apophis’ infernal ROAR makes the ground tremble. Unnatura night cloaks the horizon. This thing of nightmares travel in a HAZE OF DARKNESS. Approaching fast...
What is it?
Apophis. The Demon of Chaos. It’s drawn to the Nile, the source of all life.
Why?
To drink it. Bek looks around at lush, green Egypt... His home. He pal at the thought of its destruction.
Only Ra can banish Apophis. (pointing) But he needs that. RA’S SPEAR sticks up from the center of an IMPACT CRATER. (CONTINUED)

If we return his spear to him, he'll be revived. The SOUND OF BEATING WINGS overhead... Set DESCENDS from the sky... BLOCKING Bek and Horus from spear. Set’s surprised Horus is alive -- but not that surprised.
You could have gone peacefully into the fire. (to Bek) And you rejected my gift. Behind Set, Urshu leads a CADRE OF SOLDIERS to Ra’s Spear Urshu wrenches the heavy spear from the ground...

(to Urshu) Take it into the Obelisk. Ten mountains-worth of stone will bury Ra’s spear forever. Urshu heaves Ra’s Spear over his shoulder, carries it TOW THE OBELISK. The rest of the Soldiers flank their god... .»..as Set readies his scepter to take on Horus.
(to Bek) Get the spear.
(off Set) He’1ll kill you.

Not right away. (a farewell) You’re a good man. Bek SPRINTS after Urshu... Apophis’ ROAR rattles the world. The blackness blotting t horizon takes SERPENTINE FORM... Set comes at Horus, scepter swinging. Horus PARRIES -- But Set is stronger since they last fought. And Horus weaker. The force of Set’s BLOWS knocks Horus to his knee (CONTINUED)
You overestimate yourself. I suppose the son always becomes the father.
Not always. Set cocks back for another brutal swing -- Suddenly Set’s own Soldiers attack him. Harmless, yet distracting as a swarm of flies.
(angrily, to his Soldiers) What are you thinking?

Maybe they’ve finally realized what a jackass you are. ON HATHOR, nearby. She’s using her power of suggestion to control Set’s Soldiers like marionettes. Set KNOCKS ASIDE his mesmerized Soldiers... but it allows Horus precious seconds to get to his feet...
(to Hathor) Get back -- Too late. Set SLAMS Hathor with his scepter. At the sight of his fallen beloved, Horus’ rage explodes.
If you’ve killed her... Horus rushes to Hathor’s side. She’s alive, but unconscio

I won't until I’ve had her one last time. We’ll use your corpse for a bed. EMANATING HEAT, Horus CHARGES Set -- Set OVERTURNS a big URN from among the stockpile of build supplies. LIQUID flows across Horus’ path... It's OIL. Set smirks. He’s baited Horus once again.
Burn. (CONTINUED)

A flood of oil that could light a thousand lamps now spla across Horus’ scalding feet... His anger sparks a small FLOWER OF FLAME. The fire licks the surface... GROWING... Horus takes a breath. Bek’s words echoing in his head...
(to himself) Remember who you are... Horus cools. To Set’s dismay, Horus presses his palm on t growing flame... and EXTINGUISHES it.
Aren’t you angry? Surely your mother’s cries still echo in your ears? Your father’s sundered corpse still stains your mind?
Today I’m not a son avenging his father. (beat) I'm a king protecting his people.
You're not king yet. Horus ATTACKS. Drives Set down a LOADING CANAL used for ferrying blocks of limestone... All the way to the

head_text.subj: DOCKS ON THE SHORE OF THE NILE

text: Hundreds of BOATS here -- all abandoned now. Horus JABS Set in the chest. Set staggers... But _in his armor, Set cannot be harmed.
Angry or calm, it makes no difference. It’s too late now. Horus watches in horror as the FOREST on the FAR SHORE SHAKES... Trees uprooted...

Slithers INTO THE NILE, sending WAVES crashing ashore... A wall of water SWEEPS Horus and Set ONTO A SAILBOAT. Apophis begins to DRINK the Nile. Its gargantuan MOUTH sucking in water like a vortex into hell. (CONTINUED)
Horus and Set’s boat is PULLED AWAY FROM SHORE by the current, along with EVERY BOAT ON THE RIVER...

Bek ENTERS the Obelisk’s PITCH BLACK cavernous space... He can hear Urshu’s FOOTSTEPS ahead... then the quiet ech of a CRANKED LEVER -- An ominous RUMBLE... Whether by machination, magic, or both... the Obelisk is starting to FALL. SHAFTS OF LIGHT angle through CRACKS in the miles-high interior... As the light increases, Bek notices he stands amongst ROPES ON PULLEYS, hanging like cables to the star Bek spots Urshu in the center of the Obelisk... Urshu pla Ra’s Spear on the floor and awaits his doom...
You picked the wrong god to follow.
Oh? Horus is out there dying. Chunks of stone RAIN DOWN around them...
So will you.

I’m the richest man in Egypt. Soon I‘ll be in the Afterlife. But you'll be nowhere. Urshu grins at Bek as a massive piece of stone PLUMMETS d at them -- Bek grabs a rope and SWINGS... PLUCKS Ra’s Spear off the floor in the nick time -- Urshu_is CRUSHED. Bek, Ra’s spear in hand, runs for the EXIT...

head_text.subj: HORUS AND SET ON THE RIVER

text: DUEL on the out-of-control sailboat... Every time Apophis SWALLOWS, it pulls their sailboat a li closer to its giant maw... (CONTINUED)
HUNDREDS OF BOATS clog the river, all COLLIDING... A grow LOGJAM drawn inexorably toward destruction... Horus’ spear sends up SPARKS every time it glances off Se impenetrable armor...

Why keep fighting? Horus is flagging... None of his blows matter. A Galleon SMASHES into the sailboat, as boats PILE ON TOP ONE ANOTHER in the diminishing space -- Apophis’ GAPING MOUTH rises over them like a black hole - Horus TRANSFORMS into a Falcon... FLIES OFF THE SAILBOAT just before it’s EATEN by the Demon. Wings beating to ESCAPE the gale force draft, the Falcon barely makes it --
A SCEPTER slams the Falcon OUT OF THE SKY -- wielded by S in his FLYING ARMOR. The Falcon CRASHES... TRANSFORMING back into the shape of battered man.

(savagely) I want you to hurt. Because they all loved you, no matter what you did... ON BEK. Watching helplessly... Set hefts his Scepter two-handed... Brings it down upon Horus with such force the earth SPLITS beneath him. Horus lies stunned...
No matter that you were not worthy. Bek desperately RUSHES Set, a meaningless attack -- Set SEIZES Bek by the THROAT, holds the mortal close.
You could have been in the next life with a gentle breeze at your cheek. (CONTINUED)
I wanted to give you back your dagger. Bek STABS Set with the bejeweled dagger --
For Horus. The dagger melts against the god’s armor like butter. Set SWATS Bek aside with an awful crack -- Bek lands in a heap, fragile bones shattered. Horus kneel by him.
“For Horus?”

(painfully chuckles) Too much? They clasp hands. Brothers in this battle for creation. Horus wheels on Set, raises his spear -- Set looks upon Horus... But something’s different: Horus is looking at him with both his eyes.
ON BEK, smiling through the pain.
Set’s eyes misdirected on the dagger in Bek’s right hand, while the left snatches Horus’ eye from the helmet...
Alarmed, Set claws at his Helmet’s visor... There is a HO where HORUS’ EYE used to be.
No... HORUS’ P.O.V. A clear shot at the chink in Set’s helmet - Horus THROWS his spear -- This time, it flies RAZOR-STRAIGHT, cleaving Set’s head w a_burst of white fire. (CONTINUED)
Horus stalks to Set’s twitching body, tears off the armor and PULLS SET’S HEART FROM HIS CHEST.

Go back to nothing. Horus THROWS Set’s essence INTO APOPHIS’ HUNGRY MOUTH. As billion teeth gnash it... Set turns to dust. His armor an empty shell... The multitude of Slaves feel their skin HEAL, as their br vanish along with Set’s curse... But the unquenchable Apophis keeps drinking... Horus transforms into a FALCON... soars INTO THE SKY with Ra’s Spear in its talons --

location: THE OCEAN AT THE EDGE OF THE WORLD

text: Ra floats unconscious in the storm-tossed sea of darkness The Falcon Horus bites Ra’s shoulder... Ra’s eyes snap OP
Ra DESCENDS in all his glory.

Enough, beast. Ra unleashes a STORM OF SOLAR FIRE from his spear -- Apophis BELLOWS, but this time in fear. The Demon RETREAT across the horizon... Gone back to the darkness. Horus rushes to Bek’s side... He’s dying. But he looks at the world he’s saved with satisfaction.
Are you sure you’re not a god?
What would I be the god of? Stupidity?
The Impossible. Bek likes that... until the pain edges thought away. Bek’ wounds finally overcome him. He dies. (CONTINUED)
Horus bows his head in grief.
My king. Grim Anubis salutes the new ruler of Egypt.
Command me as you will. ON HORUS. It hadn’t occurred to him until now that the cr is his... He gazes at the body of his fallen friend.
Take him to his love.

Anubis guides Bek along the path, emptiness to his left a right... Past the Twelfth Gate, the Afterlife beckons... Bek leaves all the burdens of the past behind as he gratefully STEPS INTO THE LIGHT. INT. ZAYA’S TOMB - LATER Horus sadly places Bek’s linen-wrapped body next to Zaya’ He feels a thrum of power as Ra himself ENTERS. The tomb distorts around him -- for wh earthly room can hold the majesty of the sun?

I have never been in debt. And yet I am in debt to you, grandson. (beat) Ask whatever you will that we might balance the scales. Mountains will kneel before you. The winds will do your bidding. Answer quickly, for Apophis still hungers, night is always coming, and my blade is dull.
Once I’d have taken such power for myself... (off Bek’s body) But now I want nothing -- except what’s impossible for me to give. WE PUSH IN to Bek’s wrapped body... (CONTINUED)
A BURST OF pure light and Ra is GONE. The room reshapes.. Bek sits up, bound in the linens. Horus unwraps his frien Bek looks around, trying to get his bearings...
Am I?
Back? Yes. (points) You might want to help her. Bek sees Zaya is similarly struggling to unwrap herself. unwraps Zaya... Her green eyes flash, alive and happy.
The lovers embrace. Together at last. Horus gathers them both in a big bear hug.
(greeting Zaya) I’m Horus.
My lord... Zaya bows to him, overwhelmed.
(to Horus) I thought this was impossible?
Impossible? Yes. Bek smiles. Touche.

A great CROWD. HUMANS from all walks of life. GODS of all shapes and sizes. Everyone gathered for the coronation. Behind the throne, Bek stands dressed in royal finery, Za at his side. All the major gods are present. Among them, Nephthys flex her restored wings... Above, the sun shines. Squint and you can see Ra’s boat, dependable as clockwork... Thoth finally soaks up the sun’s embrace with pleasure... (CONTINUED)
Hathor gazes at Horus, beaming with love... Horus kneels... as Isis places the Double Crown of Egypt his head. A reconciliation for mother and son.
My heart is found. Horus ADDRESSES the crowd...

What happens to a man when he must buy his way into the life after death? He will lie, cheat, steal, kill, and enslave to gather the treasure he needs. And what of those men who will never be rich enough? If their cause is hopeless, why would they act any better? (beat ) From this moment on, the Afterlife must be earned not with gold, but by good deeds, compassion and generosity. To you who have little worldly treasure, the door is now open to you. To you who have much, your riches will mean nothing when you die. (beat) This life matters. CHEERS for the King. ON HORUS. He feels the North Wind softly blow... and he knows that his father is proud.
(low, to Horus) The day you finally make me rich, you do this?
(to Horus, peeved) Just like that you’re changing the rules of the Afterlife? Without first consulting the God of Wisdom?
Yes. (CONTINUED)
lll.
This system will never work. Who’s to judge whether a man is worthy or not?
You recognize truth, don’t you?
Yes, but...
You're hired.
Urshu arrogantly passes through the Twelfth Gate on his w to the Afterlife -- when Anubis STOPS.
(to Anubis, irritated) Have you not been paid? Thoth blocks the path to the Afterlife.
You need only answer my question and I will judge its truth. (beat) Are you a good man?
The best.
The only one who believes that is you. Thoth jerks his head to Anubis, who TOSSES Urshu off the path, into NOTHINGNESS.
All across Heliopolis, the PEOPLE are rebuilding... No longer slaves.

head_text.subj: HORUS AND BEK ON A BALCONY

text: Look across the Nile Valley... and beyond, at the encroac DESERT. They’re blown by a gritty gust of wind...
I hate the sand. (CONTINUED)
Get used to it. Horus spots Hathor below, surrounded by admirers... She won't meet Horus’ eye even though she knows he’s watching
She’s in a mood. I can’t tell if she’s mad I haven’t yet asked her to be queen -- or if she’s mad that I am going to ask her and she doesn’t want a husband.
You want my counsel as Chief Advisor to the King?
Tell her about the first time I saw her, right? Something about sunsets...
Just go to her bedchamber. (beat) And bring the crown.

THOTH’S VOICE speaks to us... Egypt looks like the arid l we now know. THOTH’S VOICE And so Egypt was saved. But the God of the Desert forever left his mark on our once green paradise... (sighs) So much for our greatest creation -- which I suppose must now be Man, by default. Perhaps in time you will be ready to rule yourselves. Until then, remember well as you travel your path toward the Afterlife... (beat) Be good -- or I‘1l know.
